CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 24, 1954, pg. 12 reads: "Gifts For Home - Four charitable organizations banded together to present a gift of three dinette sets to the Lemington Home for Aged and Infirm Colored Women. At the same time, the group took the opportunity to celebrate the ninety-eighth birthday of Miss Dolly Johnson, one of the popular inmates of the home.  Standing, left to right: Mrs. Mabel Stewart, Mrs. Susie Johnson, Mrs. Mary Coe, Mrs. Elizabeth Alexander, Mrs. Catherine Roberts, Mrs. Annie Arvin, Mrs. Lewis McIntyre, Mrs. Grace Booker, director of the home; Mrs. William C. Bannew, Mrs. Harry Peterson, Mrs. Josephine Page, Mrs. McKinstrey and Mrs. C.A. Taylor.  Miss Johnson, the honoree, is seated as she receives the gifts from the group from Miss Booker who made the presentation - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of fourteen women, standing, from left: Mabel Stewart, Susie Johnson, Mary Coe, Elizabeth Alexander, Catherine Roberts, Annie Arvin, Mrs. Lewis McIntyre, Grace Booker, director of the home, presenting gift to Dolly Johnson;  Mrs. William C. Bannew, Mrs. Harry Peterson, Josephine Page, Mrs. McKinstrey, and Mrs. C.A. Taylor, gathered in Lemington Home for Dolly Johnson's birthday and donation of dinette tables
